1A343BBFB72B4BF6A7365715CDA5D6D8.description: GEOMETRY: describe and represent shape, location, and movement by applying geometric properties and spatial relationships in order to navigate the world around them

C33670C5678542679490C52B8CC2347B.description: use fractions to express the probability of events happening, represent this probability on a probability line, and use it to make predictions and informed decisions

1DDA19DBD727487AA6E6A9206EC800DB.description: analyse different sets of data presented in various ways, including in stacked-bar graphs and in misleading graphs, by asking and answering questions about the data, challenging preconceived notions, and drawing conclusions, then make convincing arguments and informed decisions

063EFEA8B978490BA0042B49BEC1EDC2.description: create an infographic about a data set, representing the data in appropriate ways, including in relative-frequency tables and stacked-bar graphs, and incorporating any other relevant information that helps to tell a story about the data

121F8C60DE074F5B8FDE69AFBB544527.description: collect data, using appropriate sampling techniques as needed, to answer questions of interest about a population, and organize the data in relative-frequency tables

6D0BFB2A52C547B38E5FA2C5ED5C4A63.description: use mental math strategies to multiply whole numbers by 0.1 and 0.01 and estimate sums and differences of decimal numbers up to hundredths, and explain the strategies used
